rdf:Description.dc:title: Verso of postcard of Laura Standing Bear.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Show Indians
American Indians
Standing Bear, Laura
rdf:Description.dc:description: Verso of postcard of Laura Standing Bear. Printed text reads: Post Card. The address to be written on this side. Hand written in blank ink: I hope you will like this I will get you some more from Granny. Addressed to: Master G Hall Main St. Ledbergh. Postmark: 8 PM OC31 03.
rdf:Description.dc:source: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West

Standing Bear, Luther, 1868?-1939
rdf:Description.dc:description: Printed: Post Card. The address to be written on this side. Hand written in black ink: These are a nice pair for your collection from Granny. Addressed to: Master Gordan Hall Main St. Ledbergh. Postmark: 8 PM OC31 03.

Sands Rock, Chief

rdf:Description.dc:title: Verso of postcard of Native American men in traditional regalia on horseback

American Indians
Headgear
rdf:Description.dc:description: Verso of postcard of Native American men in traditional regalia on horseback. Printed text reads: W. Schinkmann. 9. "Post card" is written in multiple languages. Two postmarks. One reads: 16 Sept 16-17 06. The other reads: 17 Sept 2-3 06. Address and text, handwritten in black ink, are in French.
rdf:Description.dc:source: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West
